intro.description: Learn how to create a minimal working SysML project that can be enriched later.

item.title: Go to the 'Modeling' perspective
item.description: First make sure you are in the 'Modeling' perspective. If the 'Modeling'perspective is not active, in the title bar select Window > Open Perspective > Other > Modeling

item.title: Create the project
item.description: First, you need to create a SysML Project.

subitem.label: In the title bar, select File > New > SysML Project.
Enter the name of the new project and hit 'Next'.
On the next page, select 'Model' as type for the SysML model root element, and then 'Finish'.

item.title: Fill the SysML Model
item.description: In the 'Model Explorer' view a new project was created. The project created is a complete Eclipse plug-in project, and contains :

subitem.label: 'Project Dependencies', where you can add external dependencies you rely on, i.e. models you will depend on but which are stored outside of the project.
'xxx.uml' which is the empty semantic UML model.
'representations.aird' which is the top-level representation file for the project.
Refer to the SysML Designer User Guide to learn how to create elements and representations.
